C D E F G H M P R S T U W 

C

ClackClient - Class in main
ClackClient represents the client who is using the service.
ClackClient(String, String, int) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
main constructor for ClackClient Takes in the username of the client, the hostname of the server computer, and port number.
ClackClient(String, String) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
secondary constructor for ClackClient Takes in a username and hostname, but sets the port to a default value
ClackClient(String) - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
tertiary constructor for ClackClient Takes in the username of the client, sets the hostname and port to a default value
ClackClient() - Constructor for class main.ClackClient
default constructor for ClackClient sets the username to 'Anon', hostname to 'localhost', and port to 7000 using previous constructors
ClackData - Class in data
ClackData is the superclass for all data transmitted through Clack, it has two child classes, MessageClackData and FileClackData It contains 3 data members, storing the Username associated with the data, the type of the data, and the date that the member was created
ClackData(String, int) - Constructor for class data.ClackData
Main constructor for ClackData class, initializes userName and type to arguments provided, sets date to date when constructor is called
ClackData(int) - Constructor for class data.ClackData
Constructor which takes only a type argument, and initializes userName to "Anon", calls main constructor
ClackData() - Constructor for class data.ClackData
Default constructor calls ClackData(int type) with type set to 0
ClackServer - Class in main
ClackServer contains the information about the port that the client connects to and the data being sent to and received from the client It also contains a boolean value closeConnection which says if the server needs to be closed or not
ClackServer(int) - Constructor for class main.ClackServer
ClackServer(int port) is the main constructor for this class The main constructor takes a single integer port as argument and sets the port number to this value, then sets the data to be sent and received to null
ClackServer() - Constructor for class main.ClackServer
ClackServer() is the default constructor for this class The default constructor calls the main constructor with the default port 7000
CONSTANT_LISTUSERS - Variable in class data.ClackData
LISTUSERS gives a list of all users connected to the session
CONSTANT_LOGOUT - Variable in class data.ClackData
LOGOUT closes the connection
CONSTANT_SENDFILE - Variable in class data.ClackData
SENDFILE sends a file
CONSTANT_SENDMESSAGE - Variable in class data.ClackData
SENDMESSAGE sends a message

D

data - package data
 
date - Variable in class data.ClackData
 
decrypt(String, String) - Method in class data.ClackData
decrypt takes a string encrypted with a Vignere cyper and decrypts it returning the decrypted string

E

encrypt(String, String) - Method in class data.ClackData
encrypt takes a string to encrypt and a key and uses a Vignere cypher to encrypt it, returning the encryption
equals(Object) - Method in class data.FileClackData
equals() method is overridden from the Object class and returns true if the comparison of all data members of both the object passed and the FileClackData object calling the method are true
equals(Object) - Method in class data.MessageClackData
Overriding equals method to determine if a MessageClackData object equals another MessageClackData object
equals(Object) - Method in class main.ClackClient
Overriding equals method to determine if a ClackClient object equals another ClackClient object
equals(Object) - Method in class main.ClackServer
equals() is overridden from the Object class and compares two ClackServer objects and tests the equality of each data member of the objects, if every data member is equivalent it returns true

F

FileClackData - Class in data
FileClackData is a subclass of ClackData which stores data for files which are going to be sent
FileClackData(String, String, int) - Constructor for class data.FileClackData
This constructor is the main constructor for the FileClackData object, it creates the object initializing the parameters using a super-constructor, setting the filename and setting the file contents to null
FileClackData() - Constructor for class data.FileClackData
The default constructor here calls the default super-constructor, sets the filename and file contents to null

G

getData() - Method in class data.ClackData
Abstract Accessor to retrieve data of subclasses
getData(String) - Method in class data.ClackData
Abstract Accessor to retrieve unencrypted data of subclasses
getData() - Method in class data.FileClackData
Accessor method for contents of file
getData(String) - Method in class data.FileClackData
Accessor method for decrypted contents of file
getData() - Method in class data.MessageClackData
Accessor method for message
getData(String) - Method in class data.MessageClackData
Accessor method for decrypted message
getDate() - Method in class data.ClackData
Accessor method for date of data creation
getFileName() - Method in class data.FileClackData
Accessor method for filename of object
getHostName() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Accessor method to get the hostname
getPort() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Accessor method to get the port number
getPort() - Method in class main.ClackServer
Returns the current value of port for the class
getType() - Method in class data.ClackData
Acessor method for type of data
getUserName() - Method in class data.ClackData
Accessor method for userName
getUserName() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Accessor method to get the username

H

hashCode() - Method in class data.FileClackData
hashCode() is overridden from the Object class and returns an integer which is unique to the data of this FileClackData object, if fileName and fileContents are null they are excluded from the hashCode
hashCode() - Method in class data.MessageClackData
Overriding hashCode method to hash a MessageClackData object
hashCode() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Overriding hashCode method to hash a ClackClient object
hashCode() - Method in class main.ClackServer
hashCode() is overridden from the Object class and creates a unique integer for this ClackServer object

M

main - package main
 
main(String[]) - Static method in class main.ClackClient
Main method is used for testing
main(String[]) - Static method in class main.ClackServer
Main method is used for testing
MessageClackData - Class in data
MessageClackData is the subclass of ClackData, which is meant to create messages sent in Clack.
MessageClackData(String, String, int) - Constructor for class data.MessageClackData
main constructor for MessageClackData, utilizes the constructor for ClackData to initialize the userName, message, and type
MessageClackData(String, String, String, int) - Constructor for class data.MessageClackData
Constructor for MessageClackData, takes a key and automatically encrypts message.
MessageClackData() - Constructor for class data.MessageClackData
default constructor for MessageClackData, calls main constructor and sets default values for the object

P

printData() - Method in class main.ClackClient
printData prints all the client information sent by a particular user

R

readClientData() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Receives an input from the user through standard input and accordingly sends the appropriate information to the server for the server to execute the proper actions.
readFileContents() - Method in class data.FileClackData
Reads contents of a file into the fileContents data member
readFileContents(String) - Method in class data.FileClackData
Reads contents of a file and encrypts them using key before storing it into fileContents data member
receiveData() - Method in class main.ClackClient
receiveData() receives data from the server and casts it to a ClackData object, storing it in the dataToReceiveFromServer object.
receiveData() - Method in class main.ClackServer
Receives data from the client and stores it in the appropriate object.

S

sendData() - Method in class main.ClackClient
sendData() sends the data to the server.
sendData() - Method in class main.ClackServer
sendData sends data back to the Client.
setFileName(String) - Method in class data.FileClackData
Changes the value of the object filename to the filename passed
start() - Method in class main.ClackClient
start() initializes the connection to the server and loops acceptiong commands from the command line until it reads "DONE", and then closes the connection to the server.
start() - Method in class main.ClackServer
start() initializes the Server to accept Clients and then accepts them.

T

toString() - Method in class data.FileClackData
toString is overridden from the Object class and returns a string that writes out all information for all data members of the object
toString() - Method in class data.MessageClackData
Overriding toString method to print out a MessageClackData object
toString() - Method in class main.ClackClient
Overriding toString method to print out a ClackClient object
toString() - Method in class main.ClackServer
toString() is overridden from the Object class and returns a string which represents all data in the ClackServer object
type - Variable in class data.ClackData
int type can take 4 different forms declared constant, LISTUSERS, LOGOUT, SENDMESSAGE, SENDFILE

U

userName - Variable in class data.ClackData
 

W

writeFileContents() - Method in class data.FileClackData
Writes file contents to a file
writeFileContents(String) - Method in class data.FileClackData
Decrypts fileContents and writes decrypted data to a file
